caption:
This image features a stunning mountainous landscape, likely taken during late spring or early summer, as indicated by the presence of snow alongside thawed areas. The foreground shows patches of snow and flowing streams of water running between rocks, possibly from melting snow. These streams create small waterfalls that weave through the rocky terrain adorned with sparse vegetation.

Moving upwards, the scene encompasses a rugged mountain backdrop, characterized by steep, rocky faces with walls showing layers of granite and minimal vegetation. These majestic rock formations rise dramatically, embodying a rough, natural beauty typical of high mountain environments.

A notable feature of this photograph is a single figure in the lower right quadrant, a small but distinct presence amidst the vast landscape. This person, clad in light-colored clothing which contrasts with the darker rocks and white snow, appears to be engaged in hiking or exploring the area, emphasizing the scale and wildness of the environment. 

The sky above is clear and blue, indicating pleasant weather conditions and providing a vivid backdrop that highlights the earthy tones of the rocky mountain and the white of the snow. The overall composition of the photograph beautifully captures the serenity and grandeur of this mountainous wilderness, inviting a sense of adventure and exploration.
title: Packing expedition of explorer post 397 of Los Angeles area.  Hike started at 7500 ft., finished at frozen monarch lake (11,200 ft.)
